entry.tran: 浪费;耗费;浪费量;消耗量
entry.def: Wastage of something is the act of wasting it or the amount of it that is wasted.

example.ex: ...a series of measures to prevent the wastage of water...
There was a lot of wastage and many wrong decisions were hastily taken.
example.tran: 浪费巨大，同时又草率地作出了许多错误决定。

entry.def: Wastage is the process by which part of someone's body gets weaker or smaller because they are very ill or have not eaten enough.

example.ex: This can lead to bodily weakness and muscle wastage.
example.tran: 这样可能会导致身体虚弱和肌肉萎缩。

entry.tran: (雇员的)减员;(尤指学生或学员的)流失人数
entry.def: Wastage refers to the number of people who leave a company, college, or other organization, especially before they have completed their education or training.

example.ex: British universities have very little wastage and their graduates are good...
example.tran: 英国大学的退学率很低，而且他们的毕业生很优秀。

example.ex: Wages are low and the wastage rate of staff is high.
example.tran: 工资很低，员工的离职率很高。

means.word_mean: 2. anything lost by wear or waste

auth_sentence.content: This kind of wastage isn't tolerated these days.
auth_sentence.res_content: This kind of wastage isn't tolerated these days.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: But such wastage is inevitable, and even appropriate.

Sentence.sentence: This level of wastage is a tragedy that cannot continue if we are to succeed in the challenge of sustainably meeting our future food demands.
In less-developed countries, such as those of sub-Saharan Africa and South-East Asia, wastage tends to occur primarily at the farmer-producer end of the supply chain

Of the produce that does appear in the supermarket, commonly used sales promotions frequently encourage customers to purchase excessive quantities which, in the case of perishable foodstuffs, inevitably generate wastage in the home.

sentences.en: The company has made considerable savings through good housekeeping, such as avoiding wastage.
sentences.cn: 该公司通过诸如避免浪费等有效的内部管理方法节约了数量可观的资金。

sentences.en: Buy more paper than you need to allow for wastage.
sentences.cn: 考虑到损耗，买比所需更多一些的纸。

sentences.en: Voluntary redundancies and natural wastage will cut staff numbers to the required level.
sentences.cn: 自愿离职和自然减员将使员工数量减至所需的水平。
